bibl.title: The Customs Districts of Roman Egypt.

series.title: American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition

bibl.note: I. Review of the evidence concerning the customs dues of Roman Egypt: A. The external customs dues; - B. The internal customs dues. - II. The Egyptian "specificity": A. The problem of the rates attested in Egypt; - B. The multiplicity of these customs dues; - C. The specificity or non-specificity of the documentation for the province of Egypt.

bibl.title: Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007

bibl.seg: COTTIER Michel, The Customs Districts of Roman Egypt.

Traianos GAGOS (Editor), Adam HYATT (Assistant Editor), Proceedings of the 25th International Congress of Papyrology. Ann Arbor, July 29 - August 4, 2007 = American Studies in Papyrology. Special Edition (Ann Arbor, 2010) pp. 141-148.

I. Review of the evidence concerning the customs dues of Roman Egypt: A. The external customs dues; - B. The internal customs dues. - II. The Egyptian "specificity": A. The problem of the rates attested in Egypt; - B. The multiplicity of these customs dues; - C. The specificity or non-specificity of the documentation for the province of Egypt.
